title: City misses record high by 1 degree
title_page: Atlanta weather: City misses record high by 1 degree
text:
ATLANTA FORECAST
Today: Partly cloudy. High: 73
Tonight: Mostly cloudy. Low: 53
Tomorrow: Partly cloudy. High: 68
» For a detailed forecast, visit The Atlanta Journal-Constitution weather page.
The forecast called for a high of 72 degrees in Atlanta on Friday. However, the metro area surpassed that, according to Channel 2 Action News.
The high temperature in Atlanta was 75 degrees.
But that’s not a record, Channel 2 meteorologist Karen Minton said. The record, set in 1932, is 76 degrees.
Atlanta high today was 75! Athens still at 78! Warm weather continues thru next week but more rain after Tue. pic.twitter.com/GpZUlyul6C — Glenn Burns (@GlennBurnsWSB) January 13, 2017
The average high for this time of year is 52 degrees, according to Channel 2.
Temps had dropped to 70 degrees in Atlanta, 58 in Blairsville and 60 in Griffin by 7 p.m. The lows Friday night were expected to be in the upper 50s.
